basics.name: Dariusz Andrzej Wójcik
basics.label: Early career scientist
basics.summary: Polish-born applied mathematician and data analyst in the fields of astrophysics and space physics.

work.name: Space Research Centre, Polish Academy of Sciences, Poland
highlights: Ph.D. thesis: Turbulence Analysis in near-Earth Space Environment.

courses: M.Sc. thesis: Insurance Modeling in the Cyber Security Area.
Additional Data Science courses: Time Series Analysis; Regression Analysis; Data Mining; Machine Learning.
M.Sc. thesis: Stability Analysis of the Generalized Lorenz System.
Additional Physics courses: Dynamical Systems; Deterministic Chaos Theory.
B.Sc. thesis: Mathematical Modeling of the Heartbeat.
Highlights: Rector's scholarship; Graduate with honors.

publications.name: Testing for Markovian character of transfer of fluctuations in solar wind turbulence on kinetic scales
publications.summary: Turbulence, Plasma Physics, Statistical Physics, Thermodynamics, Fluid Dynamics

publications.name: Statistical analysis of stochastic magnetic fluctuations in space plasma based on the MMS mission
publications.publisher: Monthly Notices of the Royal Astronomical Society
publications.summary: Magnetic Fields, Turbulence, Data Analysis, Statistical Methods, Heliosphere, Solar Wind

publications.name: Magnetospheric Multiscale Observations of Markov Turbulence on Kinetic Scales
publications.summary: Solar Wind, Interplanetary Turbulence, Heliosphere, Interplanetary Physics, Space Plasmas, Magnetohydrodynamics

references.name: Prof. dr hab. Szymon Malinowski
references.reference: The PhD Candidate achieves results that are being published in reputable journals and presented at conferences, makes the desired progress, cooperates with the supervisor, and fulfills all of his duties.

references.name: Prof. dr hab. Wiesław M. Macek
references.reference: The candidate defended his Master's thesis in mathematics with a very good grade. In addition, he has conducted research on turbulence and reconnection in the space environment within the framework of the project topic.

projects.name: Turbulence and Magnetic Reconnection in Earth’s Space Environment
projects.summary: Data analysis on very small scales acquired from various space missions in the neighborhood of the Earth in space. With unprecedented high resolution of MMS observations in the solar wind and the magnetosphere this allows us to grasp the mechanisms driving magnetic reconnection, leading to a better description of space plasmas within kinetic theory.
